"wie kann man noch immer davon sprechen, dass die privatsphäre in zeitalter von big data und social media geschützt werden muss? es ist ja bekannt, dass unsere persönlichen daten die währung des 21. jahrhunderts sind und firmen wie facebook & co. ihre gewinne daraus schlagen. #datenschutz #privatsphäre #bigdata"

translation: "how can we still talk about protecting privacy in the age of big data and social media? it's well known that our personal data is the currency of the 21st century and companies like facebook & co. are making their profits from it. #dataprivacy #privacy #bigdata"

this post critically examines the idea that personal information can still be protected in today's digital age. the author questions how this can be achieved when companies are making profits from our data and there is a lack of control over how it is used and shared. the hashtags #datenschutz (data privacy) and #privatsphäre (privacy) show that the author is discussing this topic in relation to data protection and privacy, while also referencing big data to highlight the scope of the issue. the tone is critical and sarcastic, implying that the author believes it may be difficult or impossible to protect personal information in the current digital climate.
